meanings.definition: Covered with a hard outer layer
meanings.sent1: The old bread had a crustiness that made it difficult to chew.
meanings.sent2: The crustiness of the dried mud on his shoes showed he had been working in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The crustiness of the burnt toast was so tough, it could be used as a coaster.
meanings.sent4: Her crustiness towards strangers was like a protective shield around her.
meanings.sent5: The crustiness of the ancient armor gave it an intimidating appearance.

meanings.definition: Having a rough or harsh manner
meanings.sent1: Despite his crustiness, he had a kind heart underneath.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's crustiness was just a facade to hide her caring nature.
meanings.sent3: Grandpa's crustiness towards technology always led to amusing misunderstandings.
meanings.sent4: Her crustiness in negotiations made her a formidable opponent.
meanings.sent5: The crustiness of his tone made it clear he was not in the mood for jokes.

meanings.sent1: The crustiness of the old leather made it uncomfortable to sit on.
meanings.sent2: The crustiness of the frozen ground made it hard to dig.
meanings.sent3: The crustiness of the stubborn jar lid led to a comical struggle.
meanings.sent4: His crustiness in following rules made him a stickler for details.
meanings.sent5: The crustiness of her resolve was unbreakable in the face of adversity.
